**Golden Talisman for Longevity and Ritual Offerings**

**Title:** *Ritual of the Golden Talisman for Longevity and Exorcism*
**Scripture Name:** *Golden Talisman for Longevity and Ritual Offerings*
**One scroll.**

**Source:** *Zhengtong Daozang* (Canon of the Orthodox Daoist Tradition), *Tongxuan* (Cavernous Mysteries) section, **Rituals and Ceremonial** category.

**Ritual Procedure as Prescribed:**
Observe the rites in accordance with the prescribed form, and silently venerate the *Lishī* (Ritual Master).
The Five Stars illuminate, radiantly manifesting the Five Directions.
The Water Star repels calamities, while the Wood Star brings prosperity through its virtue.
The Upholstering Star (Yìnghuò) dissipates misfortune, and the Great White Star (Tàibái) wards off military threats.
The Zhen Star (Zhènxīng) firmly establishes its influence, benefiting both the family and the state.
The names are inscribed on jade tablets, and the words recorded in the Imperial Archives.
Riding the gusting winds, they scatter across the boundless heavens.
Entering and exiting the unseen realms, they wander and feast in the Ten Directions.
The Five Clouds hover as canopies, summoning deities and binding the winds.
They command the myriad spirits, safeguarding the celestial Sage-Lord (Xiānwēng).

**Twenty-four beats of the Ritual Drum are sounded:**
Invoking the **Supreme Three Heavens**—*Xuān Yuán Shǐ* (Primordial Beginning), *Sān Qì* (Three Breaths), *Tàishàng Lǎo* (Supreme Venerable Old), and *Èr Jūn* (Two Sovereigns)—
We summon forth our subjects:
The **Central Three-Five Officials** (Zhōngsānwǔ Gōngcāo), **Left and Right Attendants** (Zuǒyòu Guānshǐ), **Left and Right Incense-Bearing Envoys and Dragon-Cavalry Officers** (Zuǒyòu Pěngxiāng Yìlóng Qíshì), **Incense-Serving Golden Boys** (Shìxiāng Jīntóng), **Messengers Who Disseminate Words and Scatter Flowers** (Chuányán Sǎnhuā Yùnǚ), and the **Five Emperors’ Officials of Rectification and Direct Illumination** (Wǔ Dì Zhífú Zhí Rì Xiāng Guānshǐ)—each in groups of **thirty-six**.

Those who emerge must be clad in **resplendent ritual attire** (xián zhuāng xiǎn fú), wearing **headdresses with trailing ribbons** (guān dài chuí yīng).
Open the gates to summon the **local deities and spirits** (lǐ yù shén zhēn) of this region and its domain.

The humble subject now establishes the **Great Offering Rite (jiào)** and performs the **Morning Reverence (cháo xiū)**. With profound reverence, we present these **sacred talismans (dān qín)** and **sealed decrees (jiān téng)**.

We pray that the **Ten-Directional True Worthies (shí fāng zhēng zhēn)** of the **Supreme Dao (Tàishàng Dào)** may descend their **living qi (shēng qì)**, flowing into our bodies, so that our sincere supplications may swiftly reach the **Ultimate True, Boundless Dao (Wújí Dào)**, the **Three Pure Ones (Sānqīng)**, and the **Supreme Sage of the Jade Gate (Yùhuáng Dìshì)** before the **Celestial Sovereign’s august presence (Hàotiān Zhìzūn Jīnquè Yùhuáng Dìshì Yùqián)**.

We humbly invoke the **Lawful Rank (fǎ wèi)** and **Full Rank (jù wèi)**, declaring our surname and name **[blank]**, along with the **temple-officials and assembled assembly (lín tán guānzhòng)**, to jointly present our sincere petition to:

The **Supreme Boundless Dao, the Primordial and Natural Elemental Beginning Heavenly Venerable (Wújí Dào Xūwú Zìrán Yuánshǐ Tiānzūn)**, the **Jade Dawn Great Dao Lord of the Void Sovereign (Yùxuān Dàdào Jūn Língbǎo Tiānzūn)**, the **Mysterious Chaos Primordial Old Lord of the Dao and Virtue Heavenly Venerable (Wànbiàn Hùndùn Xuányuán Lǎojūn Dédào Tiānzūn)**, the **Supreme Sovereign of the High Heavenly Vault (Hàotiān Zhìzūn Xuánqióng Gāoshàng Dìshì)**, the **Hook-Array Upper Palace Heavenly Sovereign Emperor (Gōuchén Shànggōng Tiānhuáng Dàdì)**, the **Midheaven Star Sovereign, the Purple Forbidden North Pole Great Emperor (Zhōngtiān Xīngzhǔ Zǐwēi Běijí Dàdì)**, the **Divine Vapor Jade Purity Long-Life Great Emperor (Shénxiāo Yùqīng Chángshēng Dàdì)**, the **Eastern Extremity Azure Flower Great Emperor (Dōngjí Qínghuá Dàdì)**, the **Posterior Soil Earthly Sovereign (Hòutǔ Huángdì Zhī)**, the **Nine-Heaven Birth-God Supreme Sovereign (Jiǔtiān Shēngshén Dìshì)**, the **Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors (Sānshíèr Tiān Dìjūn)**, the **Five Spirits and Five Elders Supreme Sovereigns (Wǔlíng Wǔlǎo Dìshì)**, the **Mysterious Capital Ten-Thousand-Longevity Heavenly Venerable (Xuándū Wànshòu Tiānzūn)**, the **Great Pacification Protector-of-the-Realm Heavenly Venerable (Tàipíng Hùguó Tiānzūn)**, the **Boundless Life-Giving Heavenly Venerable (Fúshēng Wúliàng Tiānzūn)**, the **Great Luo Celestial Host Heavenly Venerables (Dàluó Zhūtiān Tiānzūn)**, the **Celestial Matriarchs and Consorts (Zhūhòu Yuánjūn)**, the **Twenty-Eight Constellation Star Sovereigns (Èrshíbā Xiù Xīngjūn)**, the **Twelve Palace-Hour Star Sovereigns (Shíèr Gōng Chén Xīngjūn)**, the **Upper Clarity Fortune-Longevity-Success Three Stars True Venerables (Shàngqīng Fúlùshòu Sānxīng Zhēnjūn)**, the **Emperor’s Native Star Sovereign (Huángdì Běnmìng Xīngjūn)**, the **Celestial Seat Illuminating Star Marshal (Dìzuò Zhàolín Xīngzǎi)**, the **Supreme Ministers of the Three Mysterious Axes (Tàixuān Shūjī Sānshěng Shàngxiàng Zhēnjūn)**, the **Three Elements and Three Officials Great Emperors (Sānyuán Sānguān Dàdì)**, the **Four Celestial Worthies of the North Pole (Běijí Sìshèng Zhēnjūn)**, the **Soul-Treasury Five Masters (Língbǎo Wǔshī Zhēnjūn)**, the **Nine-Heaven Golden Register Boundless-Life Birth-God (Jiǔtiān Jīnluó Wúliàngshòu Shēngshénjūn)**, the **Ten-Directional Boundless Flying Heavenly Kings (Shífāng Wújí Fēitiān Shénwáng)**, the **Three Realms Great Merit Demons (Sānjiè Dàxūn Mówáng)**, the **Three-Heaven Gate Subordinate Three Element True Worthies (Sāntiān Ménxià Sānyuán Zhēnjūn)**, the **Word-Conducting Spirit Officials (Yǐnjìn cíbiǎo Língguān)**, the **High-Ranked Masters of the Various Ministries and Bureaus (Zhūsī Yuànfǔ Zhǔfǎ Gāozhēn)**, the **Thunderbolt Three Celestial Lords (Léitíng Sān Sī Tiānjūn)**, the **Upper Realm Assembly Worthies (Shàngjiè Cháo Yuán Lièbān Zhēnzǎi)**, the **Five Peaks and Five Emperors True Worthies (Wǔyuè Wǔdì Zhēnjūn)**, the **Five Celestial Saints of the Cavernous Heavens and Blessed Earth (Wǔtiān Shèngdì Dòngtiān Fúdì Jìnglú Zhìhuà Xiān Guān)**, the **Northern Darkness Mysterious Heaven Acid-Field Great Emperor (Běiyīn Xuántiān Tángdū Dàdì)**, the **Water Palace Eastern Red Phoenix Great Emperor (Shuǐfǔ Fúsāng Dàdì)**, the **Foundational Pacification and Foundational Dispensation Scripture-Mastering Teachers (Běnjìng Běnpài Jīngjí Dùshī)**, the **Listed Worthies (Lièwèi Zhēnrén)**, the **Four Great Marshals—Ma, Zhao, Guan, and Wen (Mǎ Zhào Guān Wēn Sì Dà Yuánshuài)**, the **City Gods and Community Deities (Chénghuáng Shèlìng)**, the **Sacrificial Deities of the Inner Palace (Nèitíng Wǔsì Zhīshén)**, the **Three Realms Great Offering Rite Worthies (Sānjiè Jiào Yàn Zhēnzǎi)**, and the **Omnipresent Inspecting Spirit of Awesome Power (Xūkōng Jiànchá Wēilíng)**.

The subject has heard that **the Dao precedes Heaven and Earth**, condensing **radiant light within the chaotic void (hùndòng)**; it **transforms both yin and yang**, wondrously shaping **harmony within the primordial chaos (hóngméng)**.

Encompassing all yet bound by measure,
Embracing the boundless without limit.
Called **Xī**, called **Yí**, called **Wēi**—
Ascending to the peerless beyond the peerless;
Only **Xuán**, only **Yuán**, only **Shǐ**—
Lofty and arching ever higher.

Gazing upward, it vanishes in fleeting wonder, beyond naming;
Gazing downward, it fades into boundless obscurity, beyond reckoning.
All who dwell in cultivation—who dares transgress its bounds?

We, humble and coarse as **chū** wood,
Ensnared by dust, our essence impure.
Chasing illusory realms, we drift ever onward in the swift gallop of time;
Clutching fleeting light, we sigh in vain as the hare races past.

With solemn vow to mend our faults,
And resolve to strive for merit.
Aspiring to diligent progress in the **Dao**,
Hoping to preserve our conduct and receive instruction.

We humbly receive Your august edict,
With solemn reverence in our rites.
Dutifully following the **Xuán**’s model,
And earnestly unfolding the courtly **comportment**.

Like **kuí** and **huò**, we bend in sincerity;
Like **píng** and **fán**, we offer respect.
We humbly pray for Your august blessings,
That the **Shàngshèng**’s radiance may flow.

With **zhūfèng** winging the chariot,
Descend the **lǜniǎn dānyú** in ceremonial array;
With **xuánlóng** in harnessed flight,
Accompanied by **qiónyún yǔgài** in their ranks.

The **Three Realms** attend the **xuān**’s carriage,
Ten thousand **zhēn** receive their duties.
Our rites shall match our triple sincerity,
And not fail in our utmost devotion.

Our humble plea—
We await with deepest reverence.

Descend to the **lièbān** of sacred stations,
The **Three Realms**’ assembled **zhēnshèng**.
We now extend our obeisance,
Trusting in Your gracious presence.

Let each take their place in the **xiān** ranks,
Together reverently welcoming the **Dìyù**.

The **Luan-yu** arrives and halts, the **Hèjià** chariot descends to the hall.
With the assembled **zhēn** of the **jiào** feast, we perform the rites as prescribed in the **cháo lǐ**.

When the **cháo lǐ** is complete, we humbly approach the **jiào** platform.
The **lǐguān** presents incense, and the first libation is poured.

**Fǎshì**—
We solemnly proclaim the **fǎwèi**, and the officials of each rank, [Name] of [Surname], with utmost sincerity, address:
The **Three Pure Ones**, the **Shàngshèng**, the **Ten Extremes’ High Worthies**,
The **Yuánróng** Emperors and Empresses of the **xiānzhēn**,
The **Fāngyù** officials and masters of the **lǐngzhí**,
All **zhēnlíng** within and beyond the **Three Realms**.

I, **Rùn**, humbly receive the **liúguāng** of the **Sān Dòng**, the **yùjú** extending the **zhǎnshēng** ordinance;
The **Jiǔ Qīng** spread their **bùhuà**, the **lánghán** recording the **yìshòu** scriptures.
From the **wànbiàn hùndùn**’s transmission of the **jīng**, through the **liúhé gāomíng**’s unfolding of the **jiào**.
Grace flows through the **Huánghùn**, blessings permeate the **Qīngwēi**.
With reverence, we greet the **Shèngdàn**’s newly arrived radiance,
And with devotion, we offer the **Huáfēng**’s hymns of praise.

Our hearts cry to the heavens, our prayers strike the earth.
Ever mindful of the **Jiǔhuán**’s **yùqì**,
We seek the **Qīfǎn**’s **yánzhēn** technique.
We rely upon the **Dàdào**,
To aid in the grand felicity.

We expand the **Jīnluó**’s **xuánwén**,
And universally welcome the **Yùjīng**’s **Shàngshèng**.
May they arrive upon the **Huángdào**’s gusts,
And pause their **Bǎoniǎn** at the **Yáotán**.

Joy overflows with Heaven’s grace,
Longevity grows with the **Shèngsuàn**’s decree.
Our sincerest words are laid before You—
We kneel in humility, awaiting Your edict.

**Xuāncí**—
The **cíwén** shines with **xuánjiàn**’s clarity.
Though **shūjì** lacks fragrance, we offer it in **rǎnshèng**’s purity;
Though **píngfán** may be presented, we arrange the **miánlěi**’s rites.

May You graciously accept our offerings,
And daily oversee our devotions.
The **zūn yí** harmonize in their order,
As the **línghuā** resounds with the **jiǔzòu**’s music;
The **biāndòu** stand in solemn grace,
Surrounded by the **fúbǎo**’s **jiǔguāng** banners.

With utmost sincerity and reverence,
We pray for Your **yīnyì**’s protective blessings,
And eternal harmony in the **shēngpíng**’s joy.

We present incense once more, and the second libation is poured.

**Jìn zhuàng**—
I have heard that though Heaven is high, its hearing is low,
And though human hearts vary, they are never distant.
If one seeks longevity and prays with devotion,
Heaven’s response is certain and hidden within.

Now, with reverence, I follow Your **gūnyīn**,
Establishing the **tán** and conducting the **jiào**,
Already blessed by Your **cíguān**.
May Your **jiàngfú** and **yánnián** blessings be granted,
As our **zhēn**’s prayers are answered.

May Your **Huángtú** endure forever, Your **Shèngshòu** be ever secure.
New celebrations should flourish,
As the **chúnsōng**’s vitality thrives;
Our long-held hopes now manifest,
Before the **jīyì**’s radiant splendor.

May our longevity match the **Huáéng**’s grandeur,
Our fortune equal the **Hèhàn**’s vastness.
Let the **Zhì** align with the **Tángyú**’s era,
And the **Yōnghé** echo the **Xīhào**’s harmony.

Next, we pray for our **zhàngnǎo** to be dispelled,
And our **chényuán** to be liberated.
To **chuándào shòufǎ**, our resolve aligns with **jīnlán**;
To **shǒumò cúnchéng**, our conduct strengthens like **bīngbó**.

All petitions and supplications,
Shall be entrusted to the **gǔnmì**.

Our highest wish:
May the **yuán gài** flourish in splendor,
The **fāngyú** be serene and bright,
The **shānlíng** present auspicious signs,
The **chuānhòu** display celestial omens.
May the winds be attuned, the rains timely,
So that the **bǎigu** thrive with **dìlì**’s bounty;
May the stars shift, the seasons turn,
As **tiān’ēn**’s blessings perpetually flow.

With **tóngwén tóngguǐ**, we unite in harmony,
Bringing **fù kāng** and **shòu**.
The **yuānfēi yúyè** live in **tāo yìqì**’s vitality,
The **shòuwǔ fèngyí** embody **wànxíng**’s transformation.
All beings of awareness,
Shall realize the **wúwéi**.

With utmost reverence, we present incense once more, and the final libation is poured.

**Fǎshì**—
We solemnly proclaim the **fǎwèi** once again.

「具位臣姓某重称上启三清上圣、十极高真、日月星斗、本命星君、天地神祇、阴阳主宰、三界内外应感真灵。

The humble petitioner, [Name], of all ranks, respectfully reiterates his offering to the **Three Pure Ones** of Supreme Dao, the **Ten Directions’** Exalted Worthies, the **Sun, Moon, Stars, and Big Dipper**, the **Star of Destiny** and its Lord, the **Divine Manifestations of Heaven and Earth**, the **Masters of Yin and Yang**, and the **Responsive Spirits** within and beyond the **Three Realms**.

臣闻，万帝临轩，媿刍荛之可择；
It is heard by the humble petitioner that when the **Ten Thousand Deities** descend upon the **Celestial Court** (Yúnxiàn), they **do not disdain** even the **coarsest offerings** that may be selected—

千官侍坐，谅葑菲之不遗。
—nor do the **Thousand Officials** attending in reverence **fail to accept** the **most humble gifts**.

献酬已罄於三周，奠享幸殚於一念。
The **libations** have been fully presented in **three cycles** (of offerings), and the **sacrificial feasts** are graciously received in a single **thought** (of devotion).

以今玉杓影转，银汉光斜。
Now, with the **jade ladle** casting its **reflective glow** and the **Milky Way’s** radiance slanting like a **silver beam**—

月澹八鸾，己翩翻而上运；
The **Moon’s** light grows **faint** as the **Eight Vermilion Birds** (Bāluán) flutter and **ascend** in their **celestial flight**—

风清九凤，复摇曳以高征。
The **Nine Phoenixes** (Jiǔfèng) **soar** once more, their **graceful movements** carried aloft by the **pure winds**.

烟驷傍驰，云龙遐迈。
The **Four Spirits of Mist** (Yānsì) **gallop** close by, while the **Celestial Dragons of Cloud** (Yúnlóng) **stride far** in their **mighty march**.

臣等无从控挽，惟剧瞻驰，不胜依恋之至。
The humble petitioners are **powerless to restrain** them, only **gazing intently** as they depart, **overwhelmed with longing** to the utmost.

臣与临坛官众等，谨稽首顿首，奉辞圣驾。
Together with the **Celestial Court Officials** present at this **sacred altar**, the humble petitioners **bow deeply** and **prostrate themselves**, respectfully bidding farewell to the **Holy Procession**.

送圣颂
**Hymn of Farewell to the Sacred**

存神烧香
**Preserving the Spirit in Incense-Burning**

香官使者，左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，
The **Incense Officials and Envoys**, the **Left and Right Celestial Dragons and Tigers** (Lónghǔ), and the **Spirits of Incense** attending—

当令臣向来设醮朝修之所，
Shall **command** that the places where the humble petitioners have **established the grand ritual** (jiào) and **morning worship** (cháoxiū) **now generate** the **golden nectar, vermilion grass, and jade mushrooms** (Dānbìqíyīng).

百灵众真，交会在此，
The **Hundred Spirits and Multitudes of Worthies** shall **converge** here—

香火炉前，当愿皇图永固，圣寿万安。
Before the **incense burner’s flames**, the humble petitioners **pray** that the **Imperial Vision** (Huángtú) **endure forever** and the **Sacred Longevity** (Shèngshòu) **be ten thousandfold secure**.

十方仙童、玉女接侍，
The **Tenthousandfold Celestial Children** and **Jade Maidens** from all **directions** shall **attend in succession**—

兰烟传臣向来所启之诚，
The **orchid-scented vapors** shall **convey** the **sincerity** of the humble petitioners’ **earlier petitions**—

速达径御至真无极大道三清上圣昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝御前。
**Swiftly reaching** the **Direct Presence** of the **Supreme Ultimate Dao**—the **Three Pure Ones**, **Highest Sovereign of Heaven**, **Jade Emperor**, and **Golden Gate Emperor**—before the **Celestial Throne**.

回向
**Meritorious Dedication**

向来，
To all who have **come before**—」

**"The Rite of Golden Talisman for Extending Longevity is now complete."**

chunks.original_text: 金箓延寿设醮仪 经名：金箓延寿设醮仪。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部威仪类。 金箓延寿设醮仪 法事如式 各默礼师，存念如法 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘飙散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙翁。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老二君，召出臣身中三五功曹、左右官使者、左右捧香驿龙骑吏、侍香金童、传言散花玉女、五帝直符直日香官使者，各三十六人出。 出者，严装显服，冠带垂缨。 关启此间土地，里域神真。

chunks.original_text: 鸾舆至止，鹤驾临轩。 与醮列真，如仪朝礼。 朝礼既周，请陛醮席。 礼官上香，酒陈初献。 法事， 重称法位 具位臣姓某重诚上启三清上圣、十极高真，圆穹之帝后仙真，方域之曹僚主执，三界内外一切真灵。 臣润，三洞流光，玉局注延生之典； 九清布化，琅函垂益寿之文。 自万变混沌以传经，繇六合高明而启教。 恩流黄混，泽浃清微。 恭逢圣诞之甫临，敬致华封之颂祝臣等吁天激切，扣地勤拳。 每怀九还御气之方，欲致七返延真之术。 仰依大道，用助洪禧。 弘开金箓之玄文，普迓玉京之上圣。 来飙斿於黄道，驻宝辇於瑶坛。 喜溢天恩，寿增圣算。 具如词悃，俯伏奏闻。 宣词 词文控露，玄鉴孔昭。 黍稷非馨，谨寓染盛之洁； 苹蘩可荐，爰陈绵蕝之仪。 伏愿仓仓时歆，高高日监。 尊彝间错，伶华鸣九奏之音； 笾豆静嘉，符宝拥九光之仗。 克诚切切，庸敬渠渠。 冀垂阴翊之功，永协升平之庆。 臣等上香，酒陈亚献。 进状 臣闻，天虽高而听卑，惟人心而无间； 人欲寿而请祷，必天听以潜孚。 影响无违，鼓桴胥契。 臣今钦奉纶音，建坛设醮，已荷慈观。 降福延年，谅从真祷。 伏愿皇图永固，圣寿万安。 新庆宜增，睹椿松之茂悦； 夙心昭着，对箕翼之辉明。 寿等华嵩，福同河汉。 至治协唐虞之世，雍和乐羲昊之风。 次愿臣等障恼消除，尘缘解脱。 传道授法，志有合於金兰； 守默存诚，操益坚於冰檗。 凡有祈扣，悉藉帡幪。 上愿圆盖高华，方舆澄晏，山灵荐瑞，川后呈祥。 风调雨顺，百谷丰登成於地利； 星移斗转，四时常施於天恩。 同文同轨以同伦，曰富曰康而曰寿。 鸢飞鱼跃，均陶一炁之生生； 兽舞凤仪，普合万形之化化。 凡诸有识，悉证无为。 臣等致恭，酒陈终献。 法事 重称法位

「具位臣姓某重称上启三清上圣、十极高真、日月星斗、本命星君、天地神祇、阴阳主宰、三界内外应感真灵。

The humble petitioner, [Name], of all ranks, respectfully reiterates his offering to the **Three Pure Ones** of Supreme Dao, the **Ten Directions’** Exalted Worthies, the **Sun, Moon, Stars, and Big Dipper**, the **Star of Destiny** and its Lord, the **Divine Manifestations of Heaven and Earth**, the **Masters of Yin and Yang**, and the **Responsive Spirits** within and beyond the **Three Realms**.

臣闻，万帝临轩，媿刍荛之可择；
It is heard by the humble petitioner that when the **Ten Thousand Deities** descend upon the **Celestial Court** (Yúnxiàn), they **do not disdain** even the **coarsest offerings** that may be selected—

千官侍坐，谅葑菲之不遗。
—nor do the **Thousand Officials** attending in reverence **fail to accept** the **most humble gifts**.

献酬已罄於三周，奠享幸殚於一念。
The **libations** have been fully presented in **three cycles** (of offerings), and the **sacrificial feasts** are graciously received in a single **thought** (of devotion).

以今玉杓影转，银汉光斜。
Now, with the **jade ladle** casting its **reflective glow** and the **Milky Way’s** radiance slanting like a **silver beam**—

月澹八鸾，己翩翻而上运；
The **Moon’s** light grows **faint** as the **Eight Vermilion Birds** (Bāluán) flutter and **ascend** in their **celestial flight**—

风清九凤，复摇曳以高征。
The **Nine Phoenixes** (Jiǔfèng) **soar** once more, their **graceful movements** carried aloft by the **pure winds**.

烟驷傍驰，云龙遐迈。
The **Four Spirits of Mist** (Yānsì) **gallop** close by, while the **Celestial Dragons of Cloud** (Yúnlóng) **stride far** in their **mighty march**.

臣等无从控挽，惟剧瞻驰，不胜依恋之至。
The humble petitioners are **powerless to restrain** them, only **gazing intently** as they depart, **overwhelmed with longing** to the utmost.

臣与临坛官众等，谨稽首顿首，奉辞圣驾。
Together with the **Celestial Court Officials** present at this **sacred altar**, the humble petitioners **bow deeply** and **prostrate themselves**, respectfully bidding farewell to the **Holy Procession**.

送圣颂
**Hymn of Farewell to the Sacred**

存神烧香
**Preserving the Spirit in Incense-Burning**

香官使者，左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，
The **Incense Officials and Envoys**, the **Left and Right Celestial Dragons and Tigers** (Lónghǔ), and the **Spirits of Incense** attending—

当令臣向来设醮朝修之所，
Shall **command** that the places where the humble petitioners have **established the grand ritual** (jiào) and **morning worship** (cháoxiū) **now generate** the **golden nectar, vermilion grass, and jade mushrooms** (Dānbìqíyīng).

百灵众真，交会在此，
The **Hundred Spirits and Multitudes of Worthies** shall **converge** here—

香火炉前，当愿皇图永固，圣寿万安。
Before the **incense burner’s flames**, the humble petitioners **pray** that the **Imperial Vision** (Huángtú) **endure forever** and the **Sacred Longevity** (Shèngshòu) **be ten thousandfold secure**.

十方仙童、玉女接侍，
The **Tenthousandfold Celestial Children** and **Jade Maidens** from all **directions** shall **attend in succession**—

兰烟传臣向来所启之诚，
The **orchid-scented vapors** shall **convey** the **sincerity** of the humble petitioners’ **earlier petitions**—

速达径御至真无极大道三清上圣昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝御前。
**Swiftly reaching** the **Direct Presence** of the **Supreme Ultimate Dao**—the **Three Pure Ones**, **Highest Sovereign of Heaven**, **Jade Emperor**, and **Golden Gate Emperor**—before the **Celestial Throne**.

回向
**Meritorious Dedication**

向来，
To all who have **come before**—」

May the stars shift, the seasons turn,
As **tiān’ēn**’s blessings perpetually flow.

With **tóngwén tóngguǐ**, we unite in harmony,
Bringing **fù kāng** and **shòu**.
The **yuānfēi yúyè** live in **tāo yìqì**’s vitality,

All beings of awareness,
Shall realize the **wúwéi**.

**Fǎshì**—
We solemnly proclaim the **fǎwèi** once again.
